column4: I'm dual booting Ubuntu and FreeBSD, but I need to add FreeBSD to the GRUB menu, anyone know how?
kitche what do I add to the menu, then?
similar to the  Ubuntu entry, just change it,  for the other partition
and the name or you might get confussed
well I assume  it's like booting another Linux distro, when it comes to FreeBSD,  but by the sounds of what kitche is saying I might be wrong
virtual machines :) so much better than dual or triple or whatever boot, normalley
when trying out  Linux or BSD
haha, but where's the sense of adventure in that??
I suppouse,  but nice to have a good host OS, and then try other OS's out in it
only thing with doing that though, is you woudn't know how well it would really run on your hardware if it was psyically installed
yeah same here, and  my partition set up and that is a bit uh. so I am better off doing most of my playing around with vm's
doing that again soon, anyway off topic now
